alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: Object slips from hand or tool.

strategy_options.description: Move the object to a more stable position to prevent it from slipping further.
Use a gripper, tongs, or gloves to help secure the object more effectively.
Reduce speed and concentrate on maintaining control while lifting.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: Incorrect hand or tool placement during pickup.

strategy_options.description: Reposition your hand or tool to ensure better control and a secure grip.
Use the correct posture and hand positioning to enhance lift stability.
Clear any obstacles or reposition the object to improve accessibility and stability.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: Object moves or shifts unexpectedly during the pickup attempt.

strategy_options.description: Secure the object with a non-slip mat or by holding it more firmly.
Adjust the position of the object to ensure a more stable grip before lifting.
Use tools such as tongs or a lifter to stabilize the object during pickup.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: Too much force applied during the pickup, potentially damaging the object.

strategy_options.description: Reduce the grip pressure to prevent damaging the object.
Apply gradual force and avoid jerky movements to prevent strain or damage.
Stop and assess the situation to determine if a different approach is needed.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: Injury or discomfort occurs during the attempt.

strategy_options.description: Stop the task, apply first aid if necessary, and re-evaluate the approach.
Wear gloves or other protective equipment to prevent injury during future attempts.
Ask for help when dealing with objects that are difficult or risky to handle alone.
